column4: question: what will I have to know about unbuntu coming off debian
you should know that Dapper is much less stable than a debian "unstable" release... that's all
in other words, don't upgrade to it and cry if it breaks
what are the levels of stability in ubunty, and how can I tell them apart
i dont cry, i like it when things break, i learn more that way
there's stable and unstable, dapper being the only unstable
and dapper is even more bleeding edge than sid?
I don't know much about sid, it won't install on my pc  :(
and im assuming the current stable release is 10x more relevant to sarge
i just want a nice excuse to reformat my linux partition and put ubuntu on.
might help you get a taste for ubuntu before installing then, dunno
the combination of wide hardware support and debian apt utilities make ubuntu pretty nice
I used to swear at it
